Corollary 5.  la.  Let L and К be modular lattices on the anisotropic spaces EL and EK.  Then L - > К if and only if EL - ^EK and ^L ^^K. 
Proof.  Let a : EL - ^EK be given.  Then L = { x^ EL \ q { x,  x ) ^^L } so that aL^ { x^EK\ q ( x,  x ) € êL } ^ { x^EK\ q { x,  x ) ^èK } = K.

Any hermitian space U supports a j9^D - modular lattice if i is even since и ^ <1> ± • • • ± <1> ± <£> where e 6 u and s = dU.  However,  if U supports a p^D - modular lattice L where i is odd,  U must be a hyperbolic space.  For here uL c : êL so L must be the orthogonal sum of planes.  It is easy to see that the discriminant of each plane is —1. 
The remainder of this section now follows the format of the unramified case.

Multiplying the components of the given Jordan splitting of К by appropriate powers of p,  we see that К contains a lattice K [ J_ K^ where K [ is j9^~^D - modular or 0 and K'^ is p^D - modular or 0.

Now suppose i is odd.  Then EL must be a hyperbolic space and EK2 sl hyperbolic space or 0.  Now U can be written U = Uq ± H where Uq is anisotropic or 0 and H is a hyperbolic space or 0.  Thus U supports a lattice M^ ± M^ where M^ is /?  ^ " ^C ) - modular or 0 with EMj^= Uq and M^ is p^D - modular or 0 with EM^ = H.
